text: Our knowledge of this ancient time is limited because much of the early rock record has been obscured by the very Earth processes you have been studying , especially plate tectonics , erosion , and deposition .
Identify the most abundant gases that were added to Earth ’s early atmosphere through the process of outgassing .
Representing nearly 90 percent of Earth ’s history , the Precambrian is divided into the Archean eon ( “ ancient age ” ) and the Proterozoic eon ( “ early life age ” ) .
Most Precambrian rocks lack fossils , which hinders correlation of rock units .
How does the ocean remove carbon dioxide from Earth ’s atmosphere ?
Earth ’s first 4 billion years are encompassed in the time span called the Precambrian .
Why was the evolution of photosynthesizing bacteria important to most modern organisms ?

What role do tiny marine organisms , such as foraminifera , have in the removal of carbon dioxide ?
